title: Cautious shoppers threaten to spoil Christmas for the high street – and the economy
text:
Retailers suffered a sixth consecutive month of falling sales as shoppers shifted more of their spending online, putting the high street’s “golden quarter” of Christmas sales under threat.

Sales have now fallen for the longest spell since the financial crisis, according to a survey by the Confederation of British Industry (CBI).

The proportion of retailers reporting their October sales were down on the year outweighed those who said sales were up by a margin of 10pc.

This is not as bad as in the previous five months of declines, however, and shops anticipate an end to the falls next month.
